page.title: 08SEACROFT HOUSING ESTATE
page.content: The Seacroft Housing Estate is one of the newer estates in Leeds. Planned in the late 1930's it was built in the late 1940's. The houses were in the main semi-detached with the planners aiming to create space for living. The tower blocks of flats were added later in the mid 1960's, when it was felt that space could be saved by building upwards.Most people housed there were brought from the south of Leeds where much of the housing was Victorian. The estate now suffers from many of the problems of a large estate, and vandalism from graffiti to broken windows is frequent. This generalisation is not common to all the estate as there are also those houses with standards equal to many parts of Leeds. Growth of a community spirit is attempting to curb some of the worst excesses.
